feed.title: Combined summary - Online discussion on Taproot roll out - Tuesday July 20th 17:15 UTC

entry.title: Combined summary - Online discussion on Taproot roll out - Tuesday July 20th 17:15 UTC
entry.summary: On July 20th, an online Zoom call was held to discuss Taproot roll out post activation in November. The discussion was focused on developers and was livestreamed on YouTube, but anyone was welcome to attend or watch. Murch has a wiki page that tracks planned ecosystem support of P2TR addresses, and the organizers encouraged projects and businesses with Taproot support on their development roadmaps to contribute to the discussion. The meetup link was provided where the Zoom link was announced, and before the call, draft pre-reading links were shared, which were expected to be finalized before Tuesday. The reading list is also provided on https://gist.github.com/michaelfolkson/0803271754f851530fe8242087859254.The message announcing the online Zoom call included the details of the event - it will be held on July 20th at 17:15 UTC, and the discussion will be technical in nature, focused on developers. However, everyone was welcome to attend or watch the livestream on YouTube. Murch created the wiki page to monitor planned ecosystem support of P2TR addresses, and organizers encouraged projects and businesses to contribute to the discussion if they have Taproot support on their medium/long term development roadmap or are considering it. The message also provided a Meetup link that would announce the Zoom link for the event. Michael Folkson signed the message and included his contact information. Additionally, draft pre-reading links were shared before the call, which were expected to be finalized before Tuesday. The reading list is available on https://gist.github.com/michaelfolkson/0803271754f851530fe8242087859254. Lastly, the video and transcript from the online discussion on Taproot roll out that was held on July 20th are available. The event was focused on developers, but anyone was welcome to attend or watch. Murch has a wiki page that tracks planned ecosystem support of P2TR addresses, and the organizers encouraged projects and businesses with Taproot support on their development roadmaps to contribute to the discussion. The meetup link was provided where the Zoom link was announced. Before the discussion, draft pre-reading links were shared, which were expected to be finalized before Tuesday. The reading list is also provided on https://gist.github.com/michaelfolkson/0803271754f851530fe8242087859254.
